subject: Gardening
title: Mimicry and Deception
description: A quick, practical guide to Mimicry and Deception.

hook.text: The passion vine's leaves grow fake butterfly eggs. Real butterflies see them and lay elsewhere.

buildup.text: Heliconius butterflies avoid leaves with existing eggs to reduce competition for their caterpillars.

discovery.text: Passion vines evolved yellow bumps that perfectly mimic butterfly eggs, tricking mothers into skipping that leaf.

twist.text: Some passion vine species even vary their leaf shapes wildlyâ€”making it harder for butterflies to recognize them.

climax.text: A plant that fakes eggs and changes disguises is playing a deception game worthy of any animal predator.

punchline.text: Passion vines craft fake eggs to fool butterflies.

quiz.question: How do passion vines deter Heliconius butterflies from laying eggs on their leaves?
options: They release toxic scents that repel adult butterflies
They grow fake egg-like bumps that trick butterflies into laying elsewhere
They fold their leaves shut when butterflies land
